message: hey guys, i have a string with "000000010000001F" and i want to convert it into raw bits. If you would print the raw bits, you will get a lot of "?" (question marks) because it often has not the right code for letters.

@Samuirai I think you want "".join(str(bin(ord(x)))[2:].zfill(8) for x in that_string), but if that string is formatted as bytes in hex (e.g. "1F" == 31), then you want str(bin(int(that_string, 16)))[2:]

The right way:

    >>> import binascii
    >>> binascii.a2b_hex('000000010000001F')
    '\x00\x00\x00\x01\x00\x00\x00\x1f'

Cheating:

    >>> '000000010000001F'.decode('hex')
    '\x00\x00\x00\x01\x00\x00\x00\x1f'
If you want to get a list of int instead of a str you can map(ord, _) on that or use the array module.
